question:
Which of the following fauna have been listed under Schedule-V of the Wild Life (Protection) Act, 1972?
  1. Dugong
  2. Common Crow
  3. Common fox
  4. Fruit bats
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: Wildlife laws divide species into “schedules” ranked from I to V. Schedule I members are the best-protected species, in theory, with severe punishments meted out to those who hunt them. On the other hand, few other fauna have been listed under the Schedule 5 of the act and have been declared vermin, therefore, can be hunted. Animals listed under the Schedule-V of the Wild Life (Protection) Act, 1972 are Common crow, Mice, Common Fox, Rats, Fruit bats, Voles & Jackals. Dugong is listed under Schedule-I of the Act.
